articles.author: John Mair
articles.title: Australia begins damage assessment amid temporary respite from bushfires
articles.description: Australian authorities began assessing the damage on Sunday from heatwave-spurred bushfires that swept through two states a day earlier, as cooler conditions provided a temporary respite from blazes that have scarred the country's east coast for weeks.
articles.content: SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australian authorities began assessing the damage on Sunday from heatwave-spurred bushfires that swept through two states a day earlier, as cooler conditions provided a temporary respite from blazes that have scarred the country’s east coas… [+4890 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South Africa's Eskom extends power cuts into Monday
articles.description: South Africa's struggling state power firm Eskom said on Sunday that it would extend electricity cuts until 5 a.m. local time (0300 GMT) on Monday.'
articles.content:
JOHANNESBURG, Jan 5 (Reuters) - South Africa’s struggling state power firm Eskom said on Sunday that it would extend electricity cuts until 5 a.m. local time (0300 GMT) on Monday. 
Eskom said late on Saturday that it would cut up to 2,000 megawatts from the … [+363 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Croats vote to elect new president from candidates of two biggest parties
articles.description: The polling stations across Croatia opened at 0600 GMT on Sunday for voters to elect the country's new president in a race pitting the candidates of the two biggest parties.
articles.content:
ZAGREB (Reuters) - The polling stations across Croatia opened at 0600 GMT on Sunday for voters to elect the country’s new president in a race pitting the candidates of the two biggest parties.

articles.author: Will Ziebell
articles.title: Australia's bushfires turn neighboring New Zealand's skies bright orange
articles.description: Smoke from raging bushfires in Australia blanketed parts of neighboring New Zealand on Sunday, turning the sky over Auckland a bright orange.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Smoke from raging bushfires in Australia blanketed parts of neighboring New Zealand on Sunday, turning the sky over Auckland a bright orange. 
The city is more than 2,000 kilometers (1,200 miles) from southeastern Australia, parts of wh… [+777 chars]
